recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2. Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper.
3. In a skillet, sauté the mushrooms, shallots, and prosciutto until the mushrooms are softened and the shallots are translucent.
4. Spread Dijon mustard on the beef tenderloin.
5. Place the mushroom mixture on top of the mustard.
6. Wrap the beef and mushroom mixture in puff pastry.
7. Brush the puff pastry with beaten egg.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown.
9. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

1. In a pot of boiling salted water, cook the lobster for 8 minutes.
2. Remove the lobster from the water and let cool.
3. Remove the meat from the lobster and chop into bite-sized pieces.
4. In a saucepan, sauté the arborio rice until lightly toasted.
5. Add white wine and cook until the liquid is absorbed.
6. Gradually add chicken broth, stirring constantly, until the rice is cooked.
7. Add the chopped lobster and Parmesan cheese.
8. Serve hot.

1. Cook the egg noodles according to package instructions.
2. In a skillet, cook the beef sirloin and onion until the beef is browned and the onion is softened.
3. Add sour cream to the skillet and stir to combine.
4. Serve the beef stroganoff over the cooked egg noodles.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish.
3. Drizzle olive oil over the chicken.
4. Squeeze lemon juice over the chicken.
5. Season with garlic, salt, and pepper.
6. Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
7. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2. Butterfly the chicken breasts.
3. In a bowl, mix together the spinach, feta cheese, and bread crumbs.
4. Spread the spinach mixture over the chicken.
5. Roll the chicken and secure with toothpicks.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
7. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Cut the beef chuck into 2-inch cubes.
3. In a Dutch oven, cook the bacon until crispy.
4. Remove the bacon and set aside.
5. In the same Dutch oven, brown the beef in the bacon fat.
6. Add the bacon, carrots, and red wine to the Dutch oven.
7. Cover and bake for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, or until the beef is tender.
8. Serve hot.

recipes.recipe_name: Roasted Chicken with Lemon and Garlic
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2. Remove giblets from the chicken and rinse the chicken inside and out.
3. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels.
4. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
5. Stuff the chicken cavity with lemon wedges and garlic cloves.
6. Tie the legs together with kitchen twine.
7. Rub the chicken with olive oil.
8. Roast the chicken for 1 1/2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
9. Let rest for 10 minutes before carving.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2. Cut the butternut squash in half and remove the seeds.
3. Roast the butternut squash in the oven for 45-50 minutes, or until tender.
4. In a separate pot, sauté diced onion in butter.
5. Add chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
6. Scoop the butternut squash flesh into the pot and puree with an immersion blender.
7. Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.
8. Serve hot.

1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2. Cut the broccoli into florets and spread them out on a baking sheet.
3. Drizzle the broccoli with olive oil and sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese and minced garlic.
4. Roast the broccoli for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and browned.
5. Serve hot.

1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2. Pat the chicken dry and season with salt and pepper.
3. Cut one lemon in half and squeeze the juice over the chicken.
4. Stuff the lemon halves, garlic cloves, and rosemary sprigs inside the chicken.
5. Cut the remaining lemon into thin slices and place them on top of the chicken.
6. Roast the chicken for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the chicken is pierced.
7. Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.

1. Peel and seed the butternut squash and cut into cubes.
2. Chop the onion.
3. Sauté the onion in a large pot until softened.
4. Add the butternut squash and chicken broth to the pot.
5. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat and simmer until the squash is tender.
6. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth.
7. Stir in heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.
8. Serve hot.

1. Season the steak with salt and pepper.
2. Heat a grill or grill pan over high heat.
3. Grill the steak to desired doneness, about 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
4. Let the steak rest for 5 minutes.
5. In a food processor, combine parsley, garlic, red wine vinegar, and olive oil and pulse until finely chopped.
6. Serve the steak with the chimichurri sauce on top.

1. Preheat grill to high heat.
2. Season ribeye steak generously with salt and pepper.
3. Grill steak to desired doneness, about 4-5 minutes per side for medium rare.
4. While steak is cooking, make chimichurri sauce by blending together parsley, garlic, red pepper flakes, olive oil, and vinegar in a food processor.
5. Let steak rest for a few minutes before slicing against the grain.
6. Drizzle chimichurri sauce over steak and serve.

1. Rinse and drain a can of black beans.
2. Heat beans in a saucepan over medium heat until warmed through.
3. Heat taco shells in the oven according to package directions.
4. Fill each taco shell with black beans and top with shredded cheese and a dollop of sour cream.
5. Serve immediately.

1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
2. Season salmon fillet with salt, pepper, and chopped dill.
3. Place salmon on the grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side.
4. While salmon is cooking, melt butter in a small saucepan and stir in lemon juice.
5. When salmon is done, remove from grill and transfer to a plate.
6. Drizzle lemon butter over the salmon and serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
2. Mix together miso paste, mirin, and soy sauce to make the glaze.
3. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and brush with the glaze.
4. Bake salmon for about 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
5. Serve immediately.

1. Cook soba noodles according to package directions.
2. While noodles are cooking, peel and julienne carrots, slice cucumber, and thinly slice radishes.
3. Drain noodles and rinse under cold water to stop cooking.
4. Toss noodles with the prepared vegetables in a large bowl.
5. Serve immediately, or chill in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

1. Cut sirloin steak into thin slices.
2. Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat and add the beef slices.
3. Cook beef until browned and no longer pink, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Remove beef from skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add chopped broccoli and carrots and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
6. Add the beef back to the skillet and pour teriyaki sauce over everything.
7. Stir-fry for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until everything is heated through and coated in the sauce.
8. Serve immediately.
